title: "Can you imagine if (old)Veigar was a popular pick?"
body: Yes, I can, and it would be far less annoying than Lee, Zed, Kali or Nid.

Yes, I should never forget the LB :)

Leblanc has counters actually, mainly to her combos you can kill her or poke her back even harder, or simply just stop the combo. Leblanc is EXTREMELY squishy too and if you get cc'ed you might as well just sit there and await your death. I've played Leblanc to see if she was actually broken or balanced. Her combo isn't the easiest to hit since if you make one mistake you can die or just do no damage. She's definitely not a super high skill based champ, but she isn't the lowest either. This on top of her only crowd control is a stun that you can walk out of the way of quite easily makes her able to be countered.

I've mained AP Sona for hundreds of games I think now, she is the anti-christ to Leblanc. When Leblanc uses her W > Q (> and then R if she has ult typically) to poke her enemies, you can win the trade with your Q/Passive.

{{champion:37}} : You can do more damage or just simply stun her and stop her combination as you kill her

{{champion:103}} : Not sure if I have seen this lane enough to be professional, though Ahri can just land a charm on her when she does her poking/engaging combo

{{champion:157}} : Wind wall and while her stuff is on cooldown, engage and kill

{{champion:238}} : Not really able to counterplay LB too hard besides his ultimate ability, and the fact he does more damage

{{champion:50}} : I haven't seen this guy enough to be professional about this matchup, though he has a lot of spellvamp if I remember or just health regeneration abilities while Leblanc doesn't really have any sustain at all, and while Leblanc comes in with her W you can always stun her lol.

I play every champion you listed besides Swain, and Sona is the only one that has the upperhand in lane with LB due to her W and ult.

Ahri's combo costs just as much mana for less damage. The only hope she has is to charm LB before she ports back in less than half a second. 

Yasuo's base stats are terrible to make up for his 2x crit passive. One Q and W combo from LB literally does close to 50% of his health early on without his shield on. In addition, LB E stops Yasuo in his tracks, and Wind Wall is bugged to not block close range targetted spells in some instances.

If a LB loses to Yasuo in lane, she is either AFK or OOM.

Zed mainly has a skill match up against LB, as they both do similar amount of damage to each other. However, LB has a much easier time landing her spells than Zed and her full combo has a much lower CD.

All these champions will have to wait until late game when LB falls off to kill her. In any other situation, LB can either run if a fight turns sour, or chunk them for the better part of their health bars.
Dmg wise , she doesnt fall off. Its on full teamfights where she doesnt shine as much (or used to)

sadly, the reason this is overlooked is due to the fact that zhonya's can be considered core on most mages due to the high ap it gives.
See: {{summoner:1}}, {{item:3111}}, {{item:3102}} as common items and spells that anyone can work with, and {{item:3139}} for any AD champion facing him.

the problem with cleanse is that (assuming equal skill on both sides) you are sacrificing an offensive advantage. most often this could end up costing you the lane (altho with zed, he's got enough offense to make up for it)

Banshee's (while super effective) will cripple you if you try to rush it too early, and MS is an often overlooked item due to Maw being so much more effective in most cases.

That being said, a zed (or any mid lane champ that doesn't need sorc boots) that doesn't grab merc treads against the likes of ap assassins or bursters are fools in my book

(I personally feel that merc treads are just too good atm, the tenacity it provides is so powerful)

That's another thing, rushing hex drinker is actually very effective against Veigar because it gives you a ton more effective health because of the MR and the spell shield passive. it doesn't deal with the stun itself, but it allows you to survive his early burst very well, and if Veigar can't burst you, he is as good as dead.

Most ppl forget that even if his E and W were long ranged , his Q and R were short... he had to walk up to aa range to get his combo off , and it needed a second and a half to land. thats gives u more time to ur teammates (not stunned target) to react with shields, laterns , windwalls or ccs on Veigar.
Didn't Riot once say "We don't like to nerf champions that are already unpopular"?

according to riot, this veigar thing's not a nerf, it's a "change"
I know it's confusing... but I didn't write riot's handbook of BS euphemisms.
it's still a net nerf reguardless. Don't let technicalities obscure that.
Change means there is room for buffs in the future based off performance after the change.

The problem is veig's kit is too binary for buffs atm. You either can't do jack, or you obliterate ppl if they are stupid. There is no room for veigar to show skill or mastery, he just has to wait for his opponent to screw up. And it's that passivity that sucks.

Veigar is supposed to be one of the strongest end game champs in the game due to his infinite scaling, so why the heck should he have to rely on his opponents to screw up before he can land his burst? Should he be capable of taking the offensive once the "tables have turned"?

In fact, that was veig's identity: turning the tables on the enemy. He purposefully suffers and extreme disadvantage in lane in exchange for the ability to turn the tables on his opponents if they don't end the game soon enough. This necessitates veigar having the ability to act offensively and take proactive steps in ensuring his opponent's painful demise.

But right now, his kit is sink or swim. Either you land the stun and insta-gib someone or you miss (let's face it, simply pressing E means you "miss" for at least 1 sec) and get rekt and/or your victim gets away /laughing at you.

In short, veigar needs **more** changes before he can ever see any significant buffs simply because his core issues atm are not number balance problems.

I think I would be okay with Veigar taking Nidalee's popularity.

Nidalee is just flat out annoying, you either dodge her spear and live or get hit by it and if you don't get one-shot she just executes you with her built in, no mana cost mini flash that she can use every 3 seconds.

The only way you could really die to his combo was if you walked into the range of his stun. Otherwise he could only just Q and R you which I think in most cases wouldn't be enough or would require DFG to finish the job.

In the League of Mobility Creep, you gotta have either an instant lockdown or tons of mobility to stay alive, and Veigar had only one of that. His skillshot Q isn't going to be as reliable, and it seems to be geared more towards farming. His W is never going to hit someone without landing a stun. Period. I was unaware that health had a definable geometric shape.  

Also, assuming that DFG is still in the game and R still had a 1.2 AP ratio:  

A late-game ADC with 2000 HP (consistent with your example) and ZERO defense runes, masteries, or items (30 MR) vs. A Veigar with 1000 AP.  
DFG deals 15% current health and amplifies other magic damage by 20%. R deals 500 (+1200) = 1700 AP damage.  1700 damage with a 120% modifier due to DFG active = 1700 * 1.2 = 2040 damage

2000 with 30 MR = 2000 * 1.3 HP modifier = 2600 effective HP against Magic Damage.  

Veigar uses DFG. 2600 - 15% current health = 2600 - 390 = 2210 HP.  

Veigar uses R. 2210 - 2040 = 170 HP. **The ADC with absolutely no defense still did not die.**
